Params: {2: 'Melinoe', 3: "It's all right. She's... probably far from here by now.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'With a rueful smile, she struggles to her feet.'}
{2: 'Melinoe', 3: 'Maybe it was to atone for Aisling\'s death. Or to feel a little more... "human." Or perhaps it was just a way to give a love that had nowhere else to go...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Melinoe', 3: "Why did I do it? I don't really know myself...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Melinoe', 3: "In the end... aren't they all just different forms of love?", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Melinoe', 3: 'Maybe this is a kind of release, too.', 4: '1'}
{3: "Her metal joints groan in protest. Just as Melinoe said herself, she wasn't built for combat. She can only fight using her own life."}
{2: 'Melinoe', 3: "Liv, you've gone further and seen more than I have. So, can you tell me...", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Before anyone can react, Melinoe presses the self-destruct button, a pained smile on her lips.'}
{3: 'A violent convulsion tears through the mine, the thunderous roar echoing for a long moment before crumbling into silence.'}
{3: 'As the clouds of dust and smoke slowly part, Melinoe is nowhere to be seen.'}
{3: 'From the collapsed rubble, Liv retrieves a data storage box and lets out a weary sigh.'}
{1: 'By exploiting her love to fulfill its own desires.', 2: 'ffffffff', 3: '0.5', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory1344.jpg', 7: '1'}

{1: "It all began when that little, strange creature of unknown origin appeared by the grave of Melinoe's child.", 2: 'ffffffff', 3: '1.1', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory1344.jpg', 7: '1'}
{1: 'Melinoe took it in and poured all her love into it.', 2: 'ffffffff', 3: '0.6', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory1344.jpg', 7: '1', 8: '1'}
{1: 'And the creature... it wanted. It desired love, it needed to "be nurtured," it craved a safe home.', 2: 'ffffffff', 3: '1.3', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory1344.jpg', 7: '1'}
{1: 'So, Melinoe provided. With everything she could possibly obtain.', 2: 'ffffffff', 3: '0.4', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory1344.jpg', 7: '1'}

{1: 'She wove an enormous, intricate web to wrap the child inside it... and in doing so, became trapped herself.', 2: 'ffffffff', 3: '1.3', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory1344.jpg', 7: '1', 8: '1', 9: '1'}
{3: 'After searching the area thoroughly, the two of you fail to find any trace of "Aisling".'}

{3: "Liv collects the last metallic fragments of Melinoe, cleansing them with tender care. In a final act of grace, she lays them to rest in the ground beside Aisling's gravestone, uniting a mother and child in death."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: 'Perhaps now... Aisling can rest a little more peacefully.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'In this dream, there will be no parents who adopt her just to exploit resources, only a mother who truly loves her.'}
{3: "With Melinoe's disappearance, the attacks on Liv's M.I.N.D. and your Mind Beacon cease."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: 'You were right, Commandant. That child was the one behind it all.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "The illusions Melinoe wove... they must have been created using the child's power.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'But... why are there still minor fluctuations in your M.I.N.D.?', 3: '87'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: '...It might be related to something that child left behind.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Something she left behind?', 3: '90', 4: 'What did you do?', 5: '90'}
{3: "At the other end of your Mind Beacon, Liv's M.I.N.D. gently rises and falls."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: 'She was so desperate to have my M.I.N.D. that she risked infiltrating its outer layer.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "But she couldn't take anything away. Instead... I made her leave something behind.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Seeing your concern, she breaks into a gentle smile.'}
{2: 'We should still get back to Babylonia as soon as possible.', 3: '113'}
{3: 'She looks at you, an indescribable emotion lingering in her eyes.'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "I won't gamble with my life. Not even for hope.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'But... I hope you can promise me the same. Please?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "Alright, let's go check out that lab.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "We didn't have the time for it earlier. There should still be some useful data in there.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'She brushes the topic aside, a casual gesture that feels anything but.'}
{3: "But you remember the ghostly despair etched on Liv's face in that nightmare."}
{3: 'If you were to "die" somewhere, Liv... would probably be consumed by that same pain.'}
{3: 'Echoes from thirty years into the future reverberate in your mind.'}
{3: 'If the only way to shatter the fated ending is through your own death...'}
{3: 'A few paces ahead, Liv stops and turns. Her gaze finds you, a silent question in her eyes, wondering what has anchored your feet to the ground.'}
{3: 'The two of you press onward in the dark mine.'}
